website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you prefer a non-inflatable pad and like its feature set, but if portability is your top concern, consider other options.
pros: Easy roll-up design, carrying straps, and accessory pocket
The canvas cover easily wipes clean
Available in 3 sizes to accommodate most campers
cons: Some users say it sags in the middle

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Advertising
customer_reviews.text: My cot is 6' 10 " so I was looking for a pad the same size. I found this one which says it is 82" x 38". Even the picture on the box shows the pad with the measurements and only shows the pad section at 6' 10" it does not include the overhanging part with a small pocket which hangs over the front. The actual pad is only 78" long. They need to fix the product or change the description to indicate the actual length. When buying online you rely on the descriptions to be accurate. I will request that they send me another one that is the proper size.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: we also want to wake up after a fairly nice rest and no backache
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's big. Yes, it's bulky. No, it is not for hikers. As I and my wife call pitching a tent in a space that has water and electricity, we also want to wake up after a fairly nice rest and no backache. This mat is the closest to a mattress topper-to-go. We put them on our foldable cots that have the bed material strung up all around the frame on what seems to be Bungee Cord and is padded, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCoy

customer_reviews.title: The universal mat is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I doubted it’s quality and comfort before purchasing but after receiving it I was proved wrong. I’ll be honest it’s not the smallest or most lightweight but it’s pretty much a 2 inch think foam pad. It’s as soft as any memory foam pillow topper. The stitching and quality are awesome and I would reccomend this for anybody that is tent camping. My wife hates sleeping in a tent because of comfort and she loved my universal mat so much I bought her one and now she’s enjoying camping much more.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, slept on it for two weeks
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky...But what do you expect from an XXL size camp matters. I liked it, slept on it for two weeks :). It is soft and does not seem to produce "overheating" feel. Very good for trips when you can haul your stuff by a car.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Moog

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 inch thick!
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy. Basically $60 for cheap foam. There is no way this thing weighs 6lbs. THE FOAM IS ONLY 1” THICK. NOT 2”. Maybe they were making things at a better quality before and tried to go cheap. Piece of junk. I will be returning. Please update the product specifications to make it clear the foam is only 1 inch and low quality. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I got both the cot and pad and this was the best decision ever. I slept quite comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Varela

customer_reviews.title: Almost like the comforts on home
customer_reviews.text: This is a really comfortable pad. I use this pad under my sleeping bag. I have a bad back and I can't sleep on anything hard. Since I have found this pad I have no more problems sleeping at the camp on hard bunk beds with minimal mattresses. It also works really well on a cot. No more blowing up mattresses or having one leaking air when you need it the most. You don't have to worry about patching this one. It fits a cabela's XL cot perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brune

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product was horrible and I did not have the time to return it with my busy schedule. Bought to use for car camping. It is NOT made out of memory foam. I could feel rocks and the bottom of my hard metal car when I laid on it. It was cheap for a reason. Might as well get a blow up mattress. It also attracted hair and cotton from the moment it was laid. I’m very disappointed in this product and upset I couldn’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth the weight and cost
customer_reviews.text: Heavy to carry but 100% worth the trouble. My husband has a herniated disk in his back so sleeping on the ground is not great. He had to go on a scout camp out with our son so I got him this to go with the Teton XXL cot. It worked out great, he said he actually felt rested in the morning and his back was in good shape. I would definitely recommend this to any adult who would like to go car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Megatron

customer_reviews.title: The outside material is actually nice, as is the pocket and the roller
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced is the theme here. The outside material is actually nice, as is the pocket and the roller. However, the actual foam used, which is probably where the "cost" is, is pure trash. First of all, mine didn't expand in 75% of the surface area, it basically expanded only at the feet, and this is after 24 hours of being unrolled. It isn't a quality memory foam or anything like that, it's just garbage foam. If you lay down on it, the foam compresses 100% and offers absolutely no support. Product should cost $20 in line with the other cheap pads, I will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous. Go with Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: So I thought this might be some new major innovation based on the reviews. I gave it a shot and it's absurd. Absolutely not. It barely masks that you are sleeping on the ground. As all backpackers and car campers know, the air mattress or self-inflating pad is the way to go. Get one with a good R -rating if you are in a cold place. This is just one notch above a yoga mat. This is appropriate to picnics, but not actual sleep in a campground. I'm a healthy athletic guy in my early 30s so its not just the subjective frailty of the author. Get a 3+ inch air mattress or self-inflating pad
customer_reviews.author: N. Nakerson

customer_reviews.title: Legit pad for sleeping on the tent floor
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 of these with a backpacking tent for car camping, my son and I sleeping on top of self-inflating (thin) air mattresses on top of this. It was a comfortable setup, no complaints at all, I slept like a baby. Normally sleeping on the floor of a tent (even with a self-inflating air mattress) results in aches in my back, hips and shoulders but I was in perfect shape with this setup. In future camping trips with our larger cabin tent, my hope is this will provide a good insulation layer for a queen air mattress (2 side by side), will have to buy 2 more for the kids' smaller mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Enhancement for Teton Cots
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these pads for the already excellent Teton cots. I was completely satisfied with the cots and then ordered my first pad, which elevated the comfort to another level. It was and is more comfortable than my beds at home! Hence, I ordered 2 more for the ultimate in camping comfort. The attachment to the cots is simple and rolling up and securing them afterwards is easy. There is no bag for storage, and in my circumstances, that was a necessity, so I made my own. I've recommended the Teton cots and these pads to friends and they are all thrilled with their purchases. Lastly, these also provide a thermal barrier when it is cold.
customer_reviews.author: Llamamadre

customer_reviews.title: Dimension descriptions are extremely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: So I bought the XXL since I have the XXL cot. First it’s only 78” long instead of 82”, the weighted flap that has a pocket doesn’t even reach the edge of the cot. Second it says it’s 2.5” deep, wrong again, it’s about 1.75” deep. Pretty disappointed with this since the cot itself is so great.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for XXL Cot But Pricey...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the XXL cot that Teton sells as well. The only thing is, I think it's a bit overpriced for what it is and, as others have stated, it has an odd tendency to become wet and moist in the bottom of it after a night of sleeping, even when it doesn't seem like you really sweated or were hot the night before. Strange. Nonetheless it's awesome and rolls up very well. It's a huge piece of luggage to carry around so portability is limited unless you want to devote a whole bag to this by itself.
customer_reviews.author: J. HurleyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable , too soft .
customer_reviews.text: I knew that the mat would be thin but some reviews said it was comfortable anyway . I found to be too soft and can feel the floor from under me . I am not a heavy person . I am 134 lbs. The foam inside needs to be harder !
customer_reviews.author: milagros pena

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After using for camping my back did fell the bused like on the conventional blow up pad or foam pad. Even for rocky train you never fell the ground, or having sex on the pad during camping you will never fell pain of rocks digging into your knees. So I have to say it a great product and I highly recommend, Though if you have small car it can be a little bulky transporting however its light and can go any were wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for using with a cot; company was decent about correcting a manufacturing error
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use with a Teton Universal pivot-arm cot. It fits really well, and makes the cot very comfortable to sleep on. We tucked a flat twin sheet around the pad while it was attached to the cot, which worked much easier than dealing with a regular fitted sheet. The pad is bulky, so this is definitely a car-camping item. The pad includes two compression straps that are sewn onto the back of the pad's cover and attach with plastic buckles. One of the buckles on our pad was deformed. I contacted the company, and after a couple of emails, they agreed to replace the buckle. This should have been a simpler process, but it is getting fixed.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality foam.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely low quality foam wrapped in a large pillow case. The foam fully compresses with minimal weight and what this means is that you’ll have little to no difference between using the pad and using nothing at all. Spend a few more dollars and get a real camping pad. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisP

customer_reviews.title: Such a smart matress
customer_reviews.text: I tent camp in Colorado (not back packing) and occasionally sleeping in the back of my outback Subaru. The reason I went with this mat is because I was tired of blowing up air mattresses only to experience them deflate in the middle of the night. Even the expensive ones. So I thought - skip the air, let's get something a little bulkier, a little heavier, that I'll sleep comfortably on and won't have to continually replace. This is incredibly comfortable, does NOT take up that much more space in my car when packing and I don't have the hassle of inflating. Big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Strang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Best pad I’ve ever slept on! I’m a 54yr old with hip issues but I love tent camping. This pad is extremely well made, thick and easy to roll up. I only wish it came with a protective drawstring sack to keep it in. I had to purchase one separately. It fits perfectly in my Cabela’s single cot tent.
customer_reviews.author: MerriLou

customer_reviews.title: Shocked me
customer_reviews.text: This camping pad shocked me. I unrolled it after it arrived and tried it out. I passed out on the floor lying on this pad in no time flat. I have never been able to get that comfortable in such a little time. My wife came home and saw me a sleep on the floor and thought something was wrong. I told her I was fine just tried out my camping pad and fell asleep before I knew it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to write home about
customer_reviews.text: We got this pad for my wife and right out of the box, the foam seemed to be cut in an uneven way. There was a lump from the pad that we would have needed to cut it ourselves to fix the issue. The foam on the inside didn't feel very high quality at all. I suppose, it did what it was designed to do which was be lightweight and provide something better than the ground, but if you are a side sleeper or get discomfort from a normal mattress, this probably isn't for you. The return process, however, was easy. We didn't have any problems with that so I decided on a 3-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Zakk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Last summer I hurt my back while camping, so everything I purchased this summer was exclusively for comfort so that wouldn’t happen again. This mattress is so comfortable! It fits my new XL cot perfectly and I love the tie downs in each corner to keep it in place. It’s a bit large rolled up but worth the space in packing. I spent 12 nights on this this month and it was just as comfortable as home.
customer_reviews.author: AgileJen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Great product for what it is. Well designed and thought out with the roll up straps attached to the mat, along with a bar to help get you started. Great for cot use, although I don't recommend for use on the ground, it helps but definitely not that thick, but it is not intended for ground use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff DW

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great for car camping. Although this isn’t appropriate for backpacking it is great for car camping. It fits perfectly and securely and is a pleasure to sleep on after getting beat up in the woods all day long. I tried the regular size for my shorter cots but I will be purchasing two for my larger cots, this has become a guilty pleasure for car camping. I recommend this for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy R.

customer_reviews.title: The pad is not 82” stops short of filling the cover by about 10” or so.
customer_reviews.text: It says it’s 82” long but it’s not. The cover, if pulled as tight as you can might be 82 but the actual pad is about ten inches shorter! I’m 5’ 7” and laying down on my stomach if my toes are at the very edge my head is barely on the padded part. You tall guys will need to sleep on your side or put a pillow under the cover to get the full 82”. I bought the XXL because I like the extra room and comfort. Glad I did, anything smaller will not work. I only marked it down in comfort because I need to find something to put in the void space where the actual pad stops.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The TETON CAMPING PAD - Is an absolute MUST-HAVE when it comes to camping - seriously don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how much I love this camping pad...it's literally kept me into still wanting to camp. Ever since I got this pad along with the TETON XXL cot, I'm literally a "HAPPY CAMPER" before then I was seriously considering giving up on camping because of having to sleep on the ground in a tent....once you get older you're body just isn't what it used to be when you were a kid. Sleeping on the ground in a tent is not the way to go camping if you want to get any sort of decent sleep. Instead camping on the Teton cot with this type of thick pad is totally the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Milo W. DoddsTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Must have for outfitter xxl cot owners. So comfy!  Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: A must have accessory for the outfitter xxl cot. Makes a great cot even better. Yes it is a bit large but that is why you bought the outfitter in the first place right? So comfy!! Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad pad. I bought it to sleep on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad pad. I bought it to sleep on the TETON cot....its not enough cushion alone so I stuck a thermarest underneath it. I actually cut out a piece of memory foam (same thickness) and replaced the regular foam piece but it wasn't any better. In fact I forgot that when memory foam is cold (I was outside) its hard. So I put the stock foam back in. I mostly bought it for its ruggedness. Its good for what it is. I like that it has a wooden bar to help roll it up.
customer_reviews.author: Charone McCann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best cot pad I have tried. Fits great. Used for a week Elk hunting and slept great on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Get yo' pad on!
customer_reviews.text: My wife, bless her heart, suffers from chronic pain in her hips and back. She loves camping so you can imagine she ends up in a bit of pain in the tent and such. This pad seems to really have made her comfort at night a bit more manageable. Placed on our cot or in the back of our Subaru she has a definite added layer of comfort. In comparison to there pads this is superior and at a descent price on here. Sells for at least 15 dollars more at sportsman's in Mesa, Az.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and rolls up nicely. We purchased this to put on top of a cot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and solid. Very good quality cover. Mine had a built in rolling stick type and I had it re-rolled and put away in less than two minutes after testing it. I bought two of these and both of them expanded nicely and were extremely comfortable. The built in pillow holder and the handy cell phone pouch are nice touches. The clips are sturdy and this camping pad, (which I am using on my Camp Time Roll-A-Cot), should last years. I highly recommend this pad and though pricey you definitely get what you pay for. Great night's sleep on this.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Urquhart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, 5+ stars.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, is Teton! Great quality, super comfortable, I like that your pillow stays put inside the fabric envelope. Comfort while tent camping, I have the smaller cot and sleeping bag, all of them outstanding quality and lifetime warranty. Thinking about getting the XXL Teton cot with tent on top for the times I camp by myself. I also have the under cot storage and plan to get the side storage. Nothing but quality from this company, I’m impressed. No I don’t work for them, all this was purchased and just want to tell my fellow campers.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Martinez

customer_reviews.title: This camping mat is very plush and comfortable. It is rather bulky and not recommended for ...
customer_reviews.text: This camping mat is very plush and comfortable. It is rather bulky and not recommended for hiking trips. But if you are driving to the camp site then it's a good choice. Material looks sturdy and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Markos

customer_reviews.title: Strange Fungus Looking Substance Embedded in Material.
customer_reviews.text: Just an hour ago USPS delivered this TETON XXL Camp Pad. The pad looks great but I'm returning it for a refund. It has blotches of a strange fungus looking substance embedded in the material. I don't know if this substance is growing from the internal pad or growing on the outside material but it's Embedded. Don't know what this substance is but it's disgusting, to say the least. See attached photo. If you purchased this product make sure to check for this substance.
customer_reviews.author: james kerr

customer_reviews.title: Teton Outfitter Camp Pad and Outfitter Cot
customer_reviews.text: This Outfitter pad fits the Outfitter Cot perfectly. The pad has a very nice durable cover to protect the foam pad. It isn't extremely thick but provides additional comfort and support to the cot. I like to use a memory foam mattress topper on top of this pad and use twin sheets and blanket rather than a sleeping bag. This combination is so comfortable that I leave it set up at home for an extra bed when not using it for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Walleye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Foam Pad
customer_reviews.text: I used this with the XXL Teton Cot and it was amazing on my camping trip. It kept the chill off my back and with the corner straps it stayed in place all night. Pair this with the Teton cot and Teton Sleeping bags and you will have the best ever sleep in a tent you have ever had camping.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pad
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a Klymit Static V inflatable camping mattress for my frequent motorcycle camping trips, which didn't provide quite enough comfort for my aging back. Purchased this pad to use under the inflatable, and now sleep very comfortably. Rolls up reasonably compact into a roll about the size of my tent. Didn't do a lot of comparison shopping, so I'm not sure if I could have found a less expensive pad, but overall I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: This pad is cheap and poor quality. It is also huge and heavy. It's possible that as a big guy, I am not the target market, because I sink right into the hard surface below as if it was not even there. Not great for your hip bones... ow! For the price, you could get a decent *real* self-inflating pad... which is what I wold recommend over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe the price of these. They're cheap foam with a nice shell. You could get the same thing by getting a king size mattress topper from walmart and cutting it up. I feel like i was ripped off. The price makes sense if there was a memory foam core, but this is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: ... isn't what it used to be and this is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My back isn't what it used to be and this is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Laney-MacLuan

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt go camping with out this any more
customer_reviews.text: Found this to be very cushy and comfortable.. slept like a baby... would give more stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: chocolatejunkiei

customer_reviews.title: Foam not coming back
customer_reviews.text: I don't have time to continue waiting for the foam to become 2" and honestly I don't think it will -- the most seems to be 1.5" in various areas. I was expecting more from the guts of this sleeping pad. Everything else about it is wonderful! Nicely made, definitely 2" of material for it to re-puff up too, but it just isn't cutting it. I read some other reviews that said they might have changed the foam? Oh well. I have to return it because it has to work for me now. I might try again later.
customer_reviews.author: A.N

customer_reviews.title: HUGE!!! Great product. Comfortable for a side sleepers
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really big this is what it looks like in the long bed cab of my truck 2017 Toyota Tacoma extra crab this thing will be great for camping when I lay it down on the bed of my truck you can’t even fill the rivets that are in the liner of the truck and I weigh 230 pounds this will be a great addition to my camping experience I highly recommend this product I was skeptical at first But after many reviews I decided to get one and it’s working great
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine with the camping cot in place of a bed at my job when I need to stay overnight. Very comfortable pad. I really like the zipper pocket to keep one of my pillows in so that it doesn't fall off the bed. One of the straps snapped that connect over the bed rails. I tied it back together a bit looser and have had no further problems. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Seelye

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and comfortable. Rolls up nice. You can remove cover to wash. This is not for backpacking but if your traveling by vehicle and don't have to worry about walking far, it's great. My husband is 6'2 and its very comfortable for him on his Teton cot.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Kept me quite comfortable. I’m 110 pounds and the pad did not compress to the floor. I slept well on it. It’s lightweight and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and compact
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. Very comfortable for a thin pad. Also, eve though it’s a couple inches thick, the attached straps make it easy to roll into a compact package. My wife says it doesn’t have any chemical smell (which she often claims to smell from foam pads). Personally, I never smell anything but it’s all good with me. I should say that it even works well when I’m lying on my side and I weigh like 220.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2" thick my _ss!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for what I was expected to be a versatile sleeping pad, but I sleep on this thing and get sore spots on my pressure points because its so thin; it's 1" thick instead of the 2"s advertised, and the cushioning is so thin it's like sleeping on a quilt; however, the fastening/closure device is nice . . . had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Cot Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I waited so long to buy this cot. I've been camping for over 40 years and nothing comes close to this for real comfort. I have a very bad lower back and had contemplated giving up camping because of the severe pain I get sleeping in a tent. I purchased this just before a wilderness fishing trip I took to Canada this summer and it was unreal. I felt like I was sleeping in a bed! I also purchased the top cushion which really makes a difference. It is not light but we drive to our campsite so it really doesn't matter. It is really well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bono

customer_reviews.title: Materials ripped on the brand new product
customer_reviews.text: The material on mine was ripped when I received it. For 109 dollars for a sleeping pad I expected high quality that would last a long time. The whole seam along the end where you start to roll it up is ripping out. Not impressed. I have ordered a replacement but if the quality is sub par I'm returning it for a refund. I hope I'm able to bump this review up on the second pad I receive.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: Awesome with the cot and tent. I can camp again with a jacked up bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was a little disappointed in the thickness of the mat or perhaps the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed in the thickness of the mat or perhaps the quality of the actual foam. The cover itself is first rate and the handles/straps are well thought out. But the actual foam was just not what I would consider high quality. I have the full size version of this mat but it is the Cabelas brand and it is much more comfortable. If I were to do this again, I would just get the Cabelas version of this size. If Teton uses better foam, then I would give this 5 stars. Another idea would be to sell as an accessory a cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tri Guy

customer_reviews.title: My cot became a bed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is one of the best options if you want to convert your hard cot to something similar to a Bed. It does not fit perfectly well on the length but nothing you cannot handle or compensate with the strings it has. This pad is superior in comfort to any self inflated pad.
customer_reviews.author: SergioArb

customer_reviews.title: 75 inches long, not 82
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shouldnpull this listing. As you can see this is far from the 82 inch length advertised. It waa a hair over 75 inches. Do not buy if you are expecting 82 inches.
customer_reviews.author: E. Krones

customer_reviews.title: Just a piece of foam; not for floor sleeping at all!
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a piece of foam in a good looking sleeve! Said 2inches but is an inch at most places... issue is the foam is so week that through transit tight packing, it has already squeezed in multiple spots making it both uneven and NOT 2inches! I am a small frame only 115 pounds but it won’t do for me going straight on ground. Will be returning it :( and continue my search for comfort ground sleeping during tent camping.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: We never slept better. They were so comfortable that I bought two ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the Outfitter and the Adventurer for my wife and I to use while camping last weekend. We never slept better. They were so comfortable that I bought two more for my two daughters when we returned from camping. These pads make a great great Teton cot even better. Camping is so much better when you can get a good night sleep. We slept great.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Superior comfort
customer_reviews.text: This pad brings the comfort of the cot to the next level! It truly is like bringing your home bed with you into the woods. Offers great insulation from the cold, and superior comfort. In fact, this is such a nice set up I will be using this as a spare bed at home when I have unexpected guests - way better than those blow up bed.
customer_reviews.author: Dlrp2005

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in single digit temps A+++
customer_reviews.text: I was headed to the mountains in Colorado for an elk hunt where the temperatures were going to get down into the single digits. This sleeping pad kept me 100% warm, even with single digit temperatures, and no tent heater. Highly recommend this product. Disclaimer, I used this pad along with the XXL teton sleeping bag and XXL teton cot.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but not a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my teton xxl cott. I'd swear this setup is more comfortable than my bed at home. Well worth it if you value your back, or sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy c

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad is well built and I have been using it every day since March 2018. It's comfortable, resilient and dried quickly. I have used it on the cot but find myself using it more in the back of my suv during camping. Highly recommended this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cot pad! We used it on thE corresponding XL cot and loved it. What a difference. I’d choose this setup over an air mattress any day! We also used it on our mattress to see if we wanted to buy a mattress topper. We were sold and bought a topper. We might’ve gotten lazy and left the pads on instead of a topper, if they hadn’t been wider than our Cal King mattress.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: the fabric is great (meaning that my nylon covered bag didn't slip off ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, the fabric is great (meaning that my nylon covered bag didn't slip off it), but the foam got flattened out when it was rolled up, and never puffed up again. This made sleeping on the foam pad just as uncomfortable as sleeping without it would have been. It still insulated, I guess, but it certainly didn't cushion! Another thing -- it came triple boxed! It took half my recycling container just to deal with the packaging! Please waste fewer resources on unnecessary packaging in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for the back of my truck to use when camping, for outdoor movies, etc. However recently we started painting our bedroom and I put these in my living room to sleep on. Today has been one week sleeping on the foams and WOW! I feel just fine no issues whatsoever. I almost feel like sleeping in my own bed! Great product. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Anatoli R.

customer_reviews.title: This camp pad is the best thing I bought in a long time
customer_reviews.text: If you buy the cot you have to buy Camp Pad. I waited about three weeks before I bought the pad. Big mistake. This camp pad is the best thing I bought in a long time. It makes sleeping on the cot go from a 3 to 9 easily.
customer_reviews.author: Gravitasone

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sleeping pad. There's a bar in the end of it to help you get the roll started and ensure it tracks straight. The buckles allow you to tighten it up nicely. There's even a carry strap. If I had to give a criticism of this product, it would be that it's too soft. This thing is really wide and I got the longest version. So this particular model is made for big people. At 250 lbs I just flatten it. It's still pretty comfortable especially if I sleep on top of my sleeping bag but it would be better if the foam were more firm.
customer_reviews.author: Shadrach

customer_reviews.title: Padding doesn't bounce back to right thickness after storage
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a VERY nice cot mat but it had been rolled so tight by the manufacturer, and for probably a very long time, that one end of the mat only bounced back to about a half an inch thick when unrolled for use, even after leaving out flat with nothing on it for several days. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bee

customer_reviews.title: too bulky and heavy to be used for camping, even car camping.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize that this is way too heavy and bulky. It's like 3-4 heavy sleeping bags together. Also, after it's inflated, it's impossible to put it back to compact form outside without a vacuum. You have to consider it's size as after it's fully inflated. Probably it's even better off to have an extra sleeping bag under compared with this pad. It's maybe good to be used at home but you'd better consider it twice when camping outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jinxiang Lu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I have a back injury and its hard to find a comfortable place to sleep. This bed roll is wonderful. I did not buy a cot, but it is definately going on my shopping list, because this on a cot would be the most amazing travel bed you could ask for
customer_reviews.author: noneyerbussiness

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This is comfy when used on the Teton Outfitter XXL cot. The description says 3" thick, but the foam is actually only 2" thick. This works very well when on a cot, but not sufficient for a ground pad. It's just too "soft" a foam for that. I'd reccommend something else for the ground. This pad and the Teton cot was VERY comfortable together. I just recently used them for 4 nights. No problems. Lots of room to roll around during the night. I'd give 5 stars if the price was no so much and the pad really was 3 inches thick.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cushion for the corresponding Teton cot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as an add on to the Teton cot. Adds nice cushion to a taunt cot. Love that it rolls up for easy carrying abs storing. Also adds some warm to the cot as well, but not to the point it makes you hot.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price tag
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product. Does not work as advertised. The foam does not seem 2 inches thick at all and it does not flatten out at all. I left it out and unfolded for three day and the foam was still smashed and curled up on the ends. For 80 bucks I expected better
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't insulate very well, too bulky
customer_reviews.text: If I was going to purchase again I'd get some sort of backpacking mat that can fold down / roll up more compactly, and that provides more insulation. It's always the coldest part of the sleep until my body heat warms it up. It cushions, but that's about it. Takes up a lot of space for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Holladay

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Hard for me to clip it closed but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great . Hard for me to clip it closed but I'm 63 and strength is not what it was in my 30s'
customer_reviews.author: Leafpeeker1

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is a game changer! Added so much comfort to our XXL Teton Cots. I do wish they came with a case to keep them clean and for storage. Also, since they are for the XXL cot they are pretty large even when rolled up. I don’t picture these being good for a backpacking trip. But we absolutely loved them for our camping trip. Slept in them for 5 nights and we slept great!
customer_reviews.author: The PNW Blonde

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The one I received isn’t quite 2” thick but it’s still pretty great. Definitely worth it. It’s pretty lightweight too. I’d definitely recommend it to friends looking for a comfy lightweight pad that can’t be destroyed by a puncture.
customer_reviews.author: Christy C

customer_reviews.title: Really make a difference in comfort on the cots
customer_reviews.text: pricey but we use these pads on more than just the XXL cot. they work well on spare twin beds that have cheap mattresses. they would work well on the floor as well. Really make the cots comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestLady

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to pair with a Teton cot. It is AMAZINGLY comfortable. I had one of the best sleeps I've had in years on this thing. When its rolled, it's not as big/thick as my other foam camping pads I have and I like that, too. The pillow insert and the ties to attach to the cot are amazing features, also! Really happy.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to make a cot like a comfortable bed
customer_reviews.text: Simple and functional. Perfect addition to make a cot like a comfortable bed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Cussigh

customer_reviews.title: A cot mattress/pad just the right thickness for a raised cot.
customer_reviews.text: I have a firm cot and needed just a little padding. Nothing too thick because I don't like sinking into a thick mattress pad, bad on the lower back. I like sleeping his two inch pad on my cot because it feels comfortable. It is made well and rolls up easily. It is really difficult to find a pad that fits on a cot. So it was a great find and purchase.
customer_reviews.author: O. Fagan

customer_reviews.title: A life saver
customer_reviews.text: Adding these to a cot has made sleeping while camping much more enjoyable....
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Heaven.
customer_reviews.text: Like sleeping at home.. heavy duty and comfortable as can be, also helps hold your heat In on them extra cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Feels good
customer_reviews.text: Feels good sleeping on it. Plenty of room to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Harding

customer_reviews.title: Bit disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at this pad for weeks before pulling the trigger on it. Needed something to sleep on my cot and didn't want anything that involved inflating. I was really hopeful and looking forward to it. I don't know if its the quality foam or the fact that it is only 2 inches thick, but its just not as comfortable as I would have expected for a pad that costed $90. Not much cushion at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Just not enough
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. It's a great pad. But it's just not enough. I ended up going with the REI air and foam pad. For some reason. Foam just isn't enough. You need air for support. I own the universal and the xxl. I will probably be getting the Teton foldable beds with these. Oh and they are definitely heavy. I love my REI....
customer_reviews.author: bhavick krishna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match to Teton XXL Cot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with the XXL cot. Not as thick as advertised, but definitely does the job. It’s huge, so don’t expect to take this backpacking. Takes some time to expand out of the shrink wrapped bag. Slept on it for a week while on a hunting trip. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: CuyunaMike

customer_reviews.title: Okay camp pad.
customer_reviews.text: It seems well made and will probably last for a while. The padding is not that great though. I have to double up with another pad so that my shoulders and hips don't wake me up aching in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: lsawyer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: From the woods to a packed hotel room, I can always sleep on my side with this thing. Its durable, comfortable, and just thick enough to keep you warm in the cold and comfy on rocks. Great for back and stomach sleeping, and never stopped me from sleeping on my side. Its absolutely massive but definitely a necessity in my book. The fact that it works with the cot is the cherry on top.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for first several uses but looses its thickness over time. Still better than lying directly on cot or ground. Material is durable and outer shell easy to clean. I would probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: awsome pad
customer_reviews.text: the cot i have is still pretty new, and the fabric has not stretched yet so the cot is kinda hard. this pad made my cot so much more comfortable. i got the 80 X 30 X 2-Inch and it fit my cot which is 83.5"L x 32"W and the cot fit almost perfectly in the sleeping area. it was about an inch and a half short. great pad could be used on the ground if needed. i was afraid that on my trip it would not be warm enough on cooler nights. but this was great, we got down in the 50s and it was more then warm enough i would think this cold get down into the 40s
customer_reviews.author: Dimmelus

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ha...these things are HUGE! But they fit my Cabelas XXL cot perfectly. They add a significant amount of comfort to the cot. Almost as comfortable as my bed. I bought the Northstar Sports 1050 HD Tuff Cloth Diamond bags (here on Amazon) to store them. Those bags gobble these Pads up perfectly. Pad liner can be removed for washing, although I haven't done that yet. Rolling them up is straight forwards, so is cinching them down. I like the outer loops that allow me to attach pads to the cot. I highly recommend this camp pad.
customer_reviews.author: Skexzies

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and very very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and very very comfortable. Using the cot downstairs post op instead of having my family go up and down the stairs. The only problem....They always go out. ☺ Definitely highly recommend ! Never used it outside. Too many bugs.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that it wasn't made in America, but it does seem like a pretty decent product. It is 2" thick as described, but it is a little less firm than what I anticipated. I will be using it on the ground for camping. Despite the firmness it is very comfortable plus the extra padding your sleeping bag has to offer it will work fine. It rolls up very easy to get a tight fit just as it did from the factory. I'm not too fond of the price, but I'm a firm believer in you get what you pay for. I will be ordering another one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Tilton

customer_reviews.title: It comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Been using for about a month and am very happy with it. I'm using it on a hardwood floor and it provides lots of comfort (I do like harder beds, though). It unfurls easily and is easy enough to roll back up and store. It's large enough for my sleeping bag so I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: steven mccallan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product to our 13-year son, who has sleepover guests and a school camping trips. Not heavy to carry but thick enough to sleep well.
customer_reviews.author: Mom47

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems good and it still beats sleeping on the ground but ...
customer_reviews.text: So I have a friend that bought this same item about a year before I did (paid the same as I did), his is nearly an inch thicker than mine. Quality seems good and it still beats sleeping on the ground but for the price I wish they would have kept them thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Justus

customer_reviews.title: ... pad and the XXL cot have made for a wonderful combination. I am a Scout leader and wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: The combination of this pad and the XXL cot have made for a wonderful combination. I am a Scout leader and wanted something comfortable to use at resident camp for the week. I would recommend this to anyone. My kids even say it's more comfortable than their bed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bryan

customer_reviews.title: that is just a personal preference I like to move my pillow during the night
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use with the Teton XXL cot. Makes a huge difference in comfort. I am 6 foot 250 pounds. The pad relieved pressure point that occurred with just the cot alone. The fabric on the pad is very durable yet not uncomfortable to lay on with bare skin. It is a rather large bundle when rolled up but is not designed for walk-in camping. I don't think I will use the pillow pocket, that is just a personal preference I like to move my pillow during the night. The pad can also be used alone without the cot. My daughter uses it for sleepovers and says it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Navek

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Universal Camp Pad; Sleeping Pad for Car Camping
product_meta.description: Size:Universal/80" x 30" x 2"This is a camp pad that makes camping comfortable. The TETON Sports Camp Pads are thoughtfully designed to help you feel like you’ve brought the comfort of home to the campsite. Each camp pad is made with open-cell foam that recovers every time you roll it out. Now you can finally relax knowing a good night sleep is in store.
feature_bullets: CAMP COMFORTABLY: Thick, comfortable camping pad feels just like your bed at home; Open-cell foam pad; With this sleeping pad you’ll have your most comfortable camping trip yet
EXTRA INSULATION AND COMFORT: Camping pad provides another layer of insulation; Stay warm in your sleeping bag with our camp pad, an extra layer of comfort and warmth
LIGHTWEIGHT AND EASY TO USE: Easy to carry to the campsite; Roll-up straps with compression buckles make storage of your pad quick, compact and easy
VERSATILE: Use as a ground pad or with a cot; Camping pad fits perfectly on the TETON Sports Universal Cot; Canvas shell slips off for easy cleaning
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
